channel.title: Packet Sniffing question... (format for filter)
channel.description:
[b]nvm, i got it all working :)[/b] you can delete this post
ok, what is the format if i want to use a filter such as:: IP: 222.222.2.3 Protocol: UDP Destination Port: 27015 Strings: 'rcon' AND 'echo'
ok, what is the format of that if i want to filter it?
is it something like: rcon:echo:udp:27015:222.222.2.3
or rcon:echo:udp:222.222.2.3:27015
im not sure.. because those arnt working for me
can someone give me the right format, thanks!

item.title: Packet Sniffing question... (format for filter)
item.dc:creator: @poopy4231 poopy4231
item.description:
@poopy4231 wrote:

ok well i found out its not encrypted… its plaintext with other stuff… and the jibberish is just messed up hex that i cant convert…

this is what i want to get, something like this:
<.>
…rcon 2228360 FF FF FF FF 72 63 6F 6E 20 32 32 32 38 33 36 30
724 “lena” echo 37 32 34 20 22 6C 65 6E 61 22 20 65 63 68 6F 20
HLSW: Test 48 4C 53 57 3A 20 54 65 73 74

this is what i am getting:

…[…r.z…E…Q…E…i…=…VS01…UnReg…&…I.7…l.3FF FF FF FF 72 63 6F 6E 20 32 32 32 38 33 36 3037 32 34 20 22 6C 65 6E 61 22 20 65 63 68 6F 20
48 4C 53 57 3A 20 54 65 73 74.

i think thats what is what im supposed to get… but messed up hex or some other kind of code… idk…

or its just the sniffer im using, its probably putting my code into chunks…i dunno

any ideas on how to read it, and the format for the capture filter?[br][size=1]Posted at: November 24, 2006, 02:04:09 AM[/size][hr]nvm, i got it all working you can delete this thread

Read full topic
